vague_description: Determine the optimal mix of two extraction processes based on resource constraints and output.
detailed_description: There are two ways to extract metal from mined ores. The first way is to use process J and the second is process P. Process J can extract \param{MetalJ} units of metal using \param{WaterJ} units of water and produces \param{PollutionJ} units of pollution. Process P can extract \param{MetalP} units of metal using \param{WaterP} units of water and produces \param{PollutionP} units of pollution. There can be at most \param{MaxWater} units of water and \param{MaxPollution} units of pollution. How many of each type of processes should be performed to maximize the amount of metal extracted?
target_objective: Maximize the total amount of metal extracted from mined ores
target_constraints: Number of process J operations is non-negative
Number of process P operations is non-negative
Total water used in both processes cannot exceed MaxWater
Total pollution from both processes cannot exceed MaxPollution
target_parameters: Units of metal extracted using process J
Units of water used by process J
Units of pollution produced by process J
Units of metal extracted using process P
Units of water used by process P
Units of pollution produced by process P
